titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the St. Peter's Church certificates of incorporation 1974.150
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:18:30 +0000.

did.unittitle: St. Peter's Church certificates of incorporation

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: St. Peter's Church (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)

did.abstract: St. Peter's Church certificates of incorporation, dated 1832. St. Peter's was an African-American Episcopal church that met in the Apprentice's Library in the Brooklyn Heights neighborhood of Brooklyn.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); St. Peter's Church certificates of incorporation, 1974.150, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
